element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text: This algorithm analyzes the statistical correlation between two fields in a table. Both field have to contain numerical values, but do not have to be necessarily numerical fields. String fields with string representing numbers are also allowed.

element.name: TABLE
element.text: The table with the data to analyze

element.name: FIELD
element.text: The field with the X variable

element.name: FIELD2
element.text: The field with the Y variable

element.name: METHOD
element.text: The type of function to adjust. The following options are available: *Best fit (try all the possible options and choose the one that gives a higher correlation value) . *y = a + bx *y = a + b / x *y = a / (b - x) *y = ax ^b *y = a e^(bx) *y = a + b·ln(x)

element.name: REGRESSION
element.text: A chart with a scatterplot and the adjusted curve

element.name: REGRESSION_DATA
element.text: A text output with the expression of the adjusted curve and the resulting value of the R correlation coefficient
